MqvRIXeId5W6_tG_WfUK_Q.text: One of the first few cafes to be set up. And till today they still serve one of the better coffees around. Unfortunately the food is just so-so and you feel like you're being rushed out of the cafe if you have nothing else on the table.

zS0ZuUosY1kmT3QPyS5RgQ.text: cute place that's conveniently located in the 'hood. sometimes, u just want a cup of artisan coffee that doesn't require a train ride to the city. expect a wait on the weekends because it's pretty small and popular. there are a few seats outside but i prefer the ambiance inside. kind of looks like a library with the amount of books lining the shelves, and it's common to see artsy-types on their macbooks scattered throughout the place. the coffee is alright. i've had better, but it's decent. the offer all-day breakfast/brunch as well as sandwiches. i've tried the turkey sandwich ($8), smoked chicken breast sandwich ($8) and turkish eggs ($8)... all good, but prefer the sandwiches. i think the desserts were even better. the grasshopper pie ($8 i think) is all sorts of yum if you like the mint + chocolate combo. also, they put orange slices in the water, which is a nice touch. i mean, this isn't the place you'd trek to if you don't live in the east, but for the easties, i'm glad it exists.

photos.caption: Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. nice fixie by the storefront

ED4Hdn-ZSGU7WKW5I9wc7g.text: Coffee - probably best in East Coast area.Breakfast - Poached eggs on toast is good but isn't consistent. Flavours tend to drift towards the more savoury and sometimes this can be overpowering. Stay away from the scrambled eggs. It left the impression that we were eating something like oatmeal. Too much milk or butter or both.Cakes - great selection of cakes. Goes well with their coffee.In summary, if you live on the east coast and Tanjong Katong, this is probably one of the better coffee joints around.

2BROSGQeQfmVpmXhFlZ0DQ.text: Far from granting academic degrees, least associated with research intensive facilities but this exclusive "Institution" - Penny University could make it to the highest coffee bar ranking in near future, if the sector ever have an achieving U15 or U21 group or alike. We are incapable of fore-speaking the future, the same goes to any economist and policy makers, hence we are in no way to crystal-ball their success, until perseverance turned fruitful.Peculiar name it has. A coffee shop - deck out interestingly in modern lighting fixtures, serving you in its customized bar and counter table tops using recycled railroad ties (by THE RAIL LIFE CO.), with a raw finishing - polished cement flooring. I walked in and find myself a table seat, adjacent to the communal table. I wish I had a chance to the booth seat for a more enclosed space or that little couch corner for a homely feel, still I had a wonderful time just people watching in the open area. I returned to the counter for my orders. The menu clip on a wooden board is not long, making your choice is a lot more easier. Serving a small range of breakfast and a few selection of tea/coffee, the friendly young lady took the orders on her electronic portable tablet. While I am charmed by the catchy wood-cut coffee menu pinned on the wall, I find the old rustic-looking cash register very striking. I don't seem to spot any functioning one (no receipts-paperless & they accept only Cash), how cool.Seconds after I made payment, I find myself honing after some treats. The see-through display shelved some mouth-watering cakes, pies, tarts (supplied by other home-grown bakeries, by Fluff Bakery, Windowsillpies)  Surely I have missed the pop-up cookies store - my lovebites on their Salted caramel butter biscuits but still managed to try a piece of  that crunchy earl grey tea almond ones.A bit nosy I confessed. I have to bring myself to ask why Penny University and not any others? Mouss - the barista & owner, was busy brewing his delicate Brazilian blend, from Oriole Coffee & Nylon Coffee Roaster. The guy who spent time learning from teachers at the London BRAT, find me hard to ignore as I was standing right in front of this World Barista champ weapon - La Marzocco. Speaking in a soft tone, he lyrically described the coffee beans used, the history behind the store name et cetra. And so, I came to know that Penny University is a term coiled in London during the 18-century - a coffeehouse where people of ALL levels are charged a penny to enter and have free access to coffee, company, latest news from reporters ("runners"), gossips, newspapers and bulletins. Many more coffee shops over the world then, were named "Penny University". How interesting to know that's how social networking came about and its evolution, wasn't it?I learn to appreciate how things fall into place, how each new start-up was conceptualized & established. The process was lengthy but each baby steps were taken painstakingly with great passion. Likewise, the 7-ounce of simply coffee and water bond together brilliantly with careful brewing method - a clean & creamy mouth-feel, less harsh. Honestly, I'd prefer this to the one using Papa Palheta roast.The breakfast toasties definitely amp up my lazy morning. I opted for a single toast instead of two but regretted as the marmite spreading the toast was marvelous. I used to make myself a slice at home but hardly these days, so when I saw them on the menu, I just know this it it! A deliberate amount is used so no worries about being overly-salted. The taste was made even more paramount when paired with cheese, supremely good! Then comes the poached eggs and a handful of rocket leaves salad to wrap up your morning - what an awakening!yelp.com.sg/biz_photos/p…If you find the marmite extract too acquiring, they offer sourdough toast with butter, marmalade & fig condiments. I like the amount of heat that browned each round slices but I didn't seem to be able to locate its tangy taste. It needed a greater dose of levain. Of course, they have a few more options available.yelp.com.sg/biz_photos/p…The Rock Cake makes a fabulous teatime treat. The Great Britain first had them during the WWII as one of the rationed food item. Quintessentially, a fruit cake with a jagged contour but minute-sized. Scone-alike, this fruit bun is somewhat moist and crumbly. The candied jumbo-sized dried cranberry & raisin fruits complement the cake which has been baked universally less sweet. Accompanied by a cup of brew - unmistakable. Enjoying this classics of British food, I can now claim to be part of the Harry Potter's gang.I know many dwellers in the east will make this their second home, sipping a minimal 3-ounce and engaged in a chitter-chatter.

photos.caption: Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. Institution by day
Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. Interior
Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. 7-ounce cuppa

WEDFSm4yv9bD0l3p2zWLGA.text: Based on the pies offering here, it has earned another star! The grasshopper pie is awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. Grasshopper pie

DbmBYyWqVIwqXMnE36JmMQ.text: The good:  After visiting a plethora of other cafes around Singapore, this one starts to stand out more and more (I almost bumped it to 3 stars).  They did well with the space, given that it's a mid height basic rectangle along a strip of stores - once you enter, it looks sleek.  I ordered the eggs, toast and tea...and everything was above average (especially the eggs).  They also have a help yourself water station and every time I got up to get something someone was there asking if I needed help (staff was super friendly, great job!).  The biggest plus was pricing, cheap compared to the rest.  That alone is almost worth a full star.    The bad:  Not a lot of breakfast items and in my opinion it's sacrilegious to have a sandwich at brunch.  I don't know what it was, but there were two occasions where something (either in the jam or bread) got caught in my throat.  I was hacking up a lung trying to get it out.  Music was...spotty.  They were battling with the connection for my duration there.  It seems the coffee/espresso menu is on the board behind the counter and not on the menu itself.  Maybe I missed it, but it is a little confusing.  I actually wanted a latte, but didn't see it on the menu.  A big negative for me is the mismatched furniture.  Like 90% of the cafes in Singapore do this, and I'm making a plea to please stop.  Invest in some quality items (that match), the table I was sitting at was all plywood and nails.  Felt like it was going to crash down at any moment.      The ugly:  I know this place just opened, so I'm hoping there will be improvements.  Time will tell, and I'll definitely be back to give it another try.  My heart is telling me they will improve, but my gut is saying they don't  need/want to.

nPqW_xGzSd981NqE03FPBw.text: Coffee is great, I love the portion sizings available but the food was not that great. Sourdough bread was too tough and seating is tight. Poached eggs are a hit or miss. Not consistent in flavour. Do go for the coffee. It really is better than alot of other cafes.

9pja6WHJO1BbWDWfy9brBg.text: One of the only cafe in east that have good cuppa, but its not the best

xmmFjm9UnurzEqbKHlxU0g.text: I'm just being nit-picking here -- Decent coffee. Food was probably all right, though I don't remember what I had that morning. What bothered me is that the room was so loud, probably because it's an enclosed windowless space surrounded with hard surfaces.  If you fancy a quiet-ish cafe  where you can carry on a chit-chat with friends without having to shouting at each other, it's probably not the best choice.

H6uIIb4PRsZLrNZM0GBZXQ.text: I thought the coffee and desserts were average at best. Parking around the area isnt the easiest to find too.

yNjbjPiq5xTXYnnGYIexbQ.text: one of the only places i found in singapore reminiscent of a us west coast hipster scene.  not that i am really a hipster but they tend to congregate around great coffee. and this place offers just that and a wonderful ambience that allows you to hang out and chat with friends.  it does not have the starbucks chain vibe.  we had desserts since the kitchen was closed.  quite delicious.  i will definitely be coming back the next time i am in singapore.

rhc_Yam1iikwNCyAKldN1A.text: Two words: Turkish EggsIt's hard to find Turkish food in the east, and though Penny University isn't a Turkish cafe by any means, they still make a mean Turkish Eggs!There are usually 3-4 poached eggs hidden underneath a big bowl of greek yogurt. The harissa    (sauce? paste? oil?) adds some spice, and when you mix it all together with the toast they give you, it's so yum! Perfect if you're looking for a light meal. I just wish they could give more bread.On a whim, I tried their peach iced tea (not on the menu) and though it was just canned peaches mixed with tea, it reminded me so much of being back in the southern US. Very refreshing.They also have bottles of water that are free for all to access. Solid cafe!

dW0p3EoLC6ZtUGEBQ_EKBQ.text: Got to give it to them coffee was indeed above average.  However if i compared it to Tolido.....hmmm......Now the kicker would be the food.  We were the first in the Cafe as it open. But boy....did it take long to get it on our table.  Taste wise it was alright.  Nothing to be wowed.  We had the Turkish egg and French Toast.  Think they should spend a little time to clean up the Cafe.  Seeing spider web at the corner where the speakers are just don't give you the cozy feeling.  So some reason the waitress were very conscious about their looks?  Flipping their hairs more often then focusing on their jobs?

photos.caption: Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore

AReGD5W8d8WGYSEqAYVS9g.text: Went there for after dinner boost. The bottled coffee is good and I tried their afogato with coconut ice cream paired with gula melaka. The coffee are fantastic. Earl Grey cheesecake is good, but I am not a big fans of cheese so I am not going to judge about it. However, I could tell by looking at the queue which mostly came for the cakes. We went there around 8.30pm and were told that the kitchen was already closed. Will go there again for coffee, the ambience is good for gathering.

photos.caption: Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. Earl Grey cheesecake
Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. Afogato with coconut ice cream
Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore

smZwE3TRCW19Q8gd8bn95w.text: Theres nothing crabby abt their $16 crab cake. Salad was soggy n mashed. Good ambience tho. Overall- overall price for the standard of food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. Their crab cake is super failed. There's nothing crab about it, all fish paste.

ICzdmzx2ZTHvehEPrg52QQ.text: Having visited Penny University for brunch, I decided to head back there to try their offerings for dinner!As crowded as this looks, it's actually alot more empty compared to brunch! Alot of customers were getting cakes to go.And this was the end results, hardly any cakes left, compared to what I saw earlier in the day.Pretty much 50% of their menu were also sold out!1. Earl Grey Tea Cake $5I decided to quickly grab the last two slices of cake in the display and it was definitely worth my while. This was more like a pound cake that tasted like tea, with a hard sugary top coating. It was quite dense and great to share amongst two people.2. Tropical Earl Grey $6So moist and so good! Best cake ever!This is by far, my favourite cake. Do not like the layers of cream intimidate you, the cream isn't sweet, the cake is super moist and I even got two more slices to take home with me. Even with the cakes sitting in the fridge for 1-2 days, the cake remained moist! The tea flavour was present in every bite, and you can even smell it!3. Peppermint Iced ChocolatePeppermint Iced Chocolate $5.50This literally tasted like an "After-Eight" chocolate in a liquid form, the peppermint flavour wasn't too overpowering and the chocolate was very real and not too heaty. My friend and I enjoyed this so much!4. Salmon Guacamole $9.50I feel that for $9.50, this was worth every penny! There was so much salmon, I couldn't find enough bread to eat it with the salmon! The salmon tasted great and the bread was very crispy and toasty. It stayed crispy even after 10-15 minutes.5. Affogato $7One dose of Affogato at noon wasn't enough, I needed a second dose! Ice cream, coffee and gula melaka! It's heavenly, I will definitely be ordering this every single time I step into Penny University! The smell of the caffeine, just wakes you up!Cakes and the Salmon Guacamole, a perfect dinner time treat, along with the Affogato, even though almost the entire kitchen was wiped out of food and we couldn't order anything else, I was still a very happy customer. Great Cakes, Great Service and Great Coffee = Happy Customers like Me :)

photos.caption: Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. affogato $7 each
Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. peppermint iced chocolate

d2XDBCu-303WPTyI6_Pecw.text: Ate here with my wife for brunch on a Sunday. Was pretty crowded but we didn't have to wait log to get a table. I had the eggs Benedict with smoked salmon and my wife had the English breakfast. Both dishes were pretty good. I would give a higher rating, but I feel like the food was average. The smoked salmon could have been a bit more flavorful, and the sausages in my wife's dish weren't anything special. I'll visit again sometime in the future because their espresso was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. English Breakfast
Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. Eggs Benedict

jOOoN3b5Iu3DHPfJhNYC_w.text: The event didn't start out that well with the Café still closed 15 minutes after the opening time, this was followed by a series of bad service and bad events.I had expected better as the place is so highly rated.Customer Service - 1 (it appears everyone there hates their job)Ambience - 4 for using crazy furnitureMenu - 4 pretty standard and simple Cost - 7 reasonable prices for SingaporeCoffee - 5 although two coffee's were delivered 5 mins apart Food - 4 pretty plan items and eggs were not cooked properly Dishes dumped on table, cutlery dumped on table. Salt and Pepper shakers empty and I took some of all tablesAll in all, I wont' visit here again and the customer service factor alone is appalling

wldxCRjHrLZg36y0BIlrRw.text: I'd like to echo most of the other reviews here. Coffee is excellent, among the best in Singapore - strong flavored without being too bitter. But they really need to step up their food game, some of their pastries are quite ordinary and dry. And service can be spotty even at the best of times. It's also really loud inside for some reason, I wouldn't hold a group meeting here cos of the echoes. I'll still come back, but only for the espresso..

Y1VN8VRdgQgdVdoECahXcA.text: What I would come here for - their amazing coffee, the mouthwatering cakes and tarts, their sourdough.However, poached eggs are hit/miss. My poached eggs yesterday were cooked through, the yolks didn't ooze a single bit (making for a sad clarey!). Still, good coffee is good coffee & this place is a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. Turkish eggs with sourdough

uLf3TARXvQf9zv6IbeQO_w.text: Really nice ambience. The turkish eggs were okay, if not uniquely spectacular. Coffee was good.

9kkqBeju71kXokm94j4gvA.text: Aww Penny needs more love.I'm not sure why the ratings are so low. The food perhaps. Never tried the food here. But, THIS IS A COFFEE JOINT!The cappuccino here was very competent. And in fact might be one of the best I've had in Singapore. (For calibration, highland, dept of caffeine, refinery are others that rank on my list. CSHH not so much.)Hooray for good coffee in the east!

eKeTUdI1oXgXFxajhX9XFw.text: Relatively quiet place to have a afternoon meet-up with friends, or at least it was when I visited on a Friday. They didn't have as many items on their menu as other coffee joints which I've visited. The espresso and choco banana pie I had was pretty good. But I felt that the strawberry shortcake and peanut butter jelly cake my mates had were pretty average. Overall, a nice place to sit down, have a mid-afternoon coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. Peanut Butter Jelly Cake
Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. 5oz Espresso
Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. Choco Banana in the foreground and Strawberry Shortcake in the back

U6bHB9LE-w3YEARTafVryg.text: Pretty much espresso based drinks for coffee and that is good. They are pretty specialized in their coffee selection but that is no turn off. The coffee is very nicely roasted and the coffee art is not bad (not that the art matters). Nice place to chill out and have a cuppa. Only thing is the space is not big so if you have a big group, it may be a problem. Other than that I'd say the coffee is eorth the trip though it is slightly more on the pricey side.

photos.caption: Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. 7oz double shot espresso with milk

XeH4Oq6JmTgqDJ6OjhPccw.text: Finally, a decent coffee joint in the east!Mous has spent a lot of time getting stuff to be awesome, from the interior, to the coffee, and it is for both reasons that I now really like coming here. It doesn't hurt that he's a pretty cool guy to talk to as well.He's spoken to local roasters Nylon Coffee as well, and they've come on board as one of his suppliers, along with Oriole as well - supporting the locals is yet another reason to love this place.Some stuff they've got on the menu include sweet treats from Windowsill Pies, and today I had some pretty awesome turkish eggs too! Poached to perfection, and spiced with harissa, they were just begging to be mopped up with some tasty sourdough, which they cleverly included. Heck, I loved that sourdough so dang much I ordered an extra portion with earl grey+fig jam, and finished that too.Closing thoughts? Cool joint, good coffee, a bike rack outside? HECK YES. Plus I love that he's got a little window right next to the espresso machine - perfect for takeaway coffees!

photos.caption: Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. Beautiful front

V-UjeIcyGNhASSIQQf6ihg.text: Can't get enough of here. Near by to home, has pies that keeps saying hello and want more conersation, a barista/owner that knows his beans, and coffee consistently satisfying. I even had brunch here once in spite of the usual coffee runs. The turkish eggs were good,  but boy is the sourdough and jam a rockstar!Yay to east siders and lazy coffee days.

photos.caption: Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. Pies and a recommended long black with raven blend!
Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. Turkish eggs! Looks delish!

0Tj6d-jXPrmqMBHlfwDj-Q.text: 1. cheese toasties - poached eggs & marmite - the poach egges were perfect! the soughdough was awesome too! toasted to perfection. - the cheese (not sure what type they used) were unfortunately it was way too salty for me :( 2. turkish eggs- 2 poach eggs with whipped yogurt & hot chili butter served with soughdough- interesting dish but probably would not order again. it tasted like a spicy sour cream dip with poached eggs. interesting, edible but not my favorite thing. (even though the staff recommend this. hm.) maybe I am not a turkish breakfast person. just a simple american breakfast person. 3. cafe latte (7 ounce, double shot) - strong! - we initially asked for an extra shot because the staff told us 7 ounce will be "diluted with milk" and we wanted to start the day with a good coffee. I guess 2 shot was overkill? the kind of bitter only diehard coffee lovers can love. I am more a mainstream coffee person. 4. smore tart - THE BEST!!! seriously, based on this item alone the place is worth a visit. the chocolate melts in your mouth! Total: $27Ambiance: nice vintage coffee joint :) great selection of magazines and books to read too (which is the perfect place to catchup on some reading on a lazy afternoon or during the late evenings when there aren't too many people. mornings tend to get crowded.) Cons: (which could have, but did not, make me give them 3 star. i believe in this place!!! it's definitely a raising start despite a few initial shortcomings... :) - cash payment only. - limited selection of brunch food (basically toast and eggs? both of which they do very well but I need something more substantial to start the day) I heard they are working on more dishes soon? can't wait to see what's installed. if it's anything like their perfect poached eggs and sourdough toast then it could potentially be a 5 star joint!

photos.caption: Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. S'mores tart
Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore

j_HE2q_vVPE-7Y0kEyjqmQ.text: They are going to open next week (I believe Oct 15th, 2012), and today I walked by this place with a friend wanting to have a couple cups of coffee. Wanted to go for kopi, and saw this place opened, and noticed the two bicycles outside of this Penny University. So we went in to check it out.The manager was very friendly, told us about the drinks and food that you offer. And he happily took our orders. The food were brought to us, and drinks followed a little bit later. The coffee drinks were great. The cupcakes were good. Since this is pre-openning, there is no charge. Tips were welcomed.This is  a clean contemporary English decorated coffeehouse, attracts young people to hang up. I believe this place opens early like 8:00am serving breakfast and closes at 9:00pm weekdays, and 10:00pm weekends.I didn't check if they have free WIFI. I will ask them the next time I go there, it is walk distance to my house on Telok Kurau Road.

photos.caption: Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore. a cup of goodness

qXrEF6Pf4DX0C8PI3blIbQ.text: I enjoy their coffee especially the cold muddy coffee with milk. Queue is rather horrible during the weekends though and there's no where proper to wait. Prices are very attractive especially for food. Most cafes charge at least 1.5x. Food is nothing extraordinary but simple and satisfying. The pies and cakes are also very good. :)

lX3b6yDBvfkRAbDKLFMABw.text: Penny's has the best coffee around, and one of our favorite places.  Unfortunately though, the last few times we have come here the service has been awfully slow. 15 minutes for a coffee and 25 minutes for a smoothie bowl.  This is on a weekday at 11am, so not a peak time. Come for the good coffee, but expect to wait.

sAAlteHVlbgjDCUp7hdROQ.text: Discovered Penny Uni by chance when visiting my usual fried hokkien mee place - Geylang Lor 29 FHM, highly-recommended.I love the decor here, especially the lighting. Not sure why they decided to waste some space on the "porch", resulting in less space inside.My first visit, I opted for a flat white in the bigger cup (forgot what the size is called), felt it was too thin, like I was drinking milk instead of coffee. Subsequently opted for the smaller cup and the mix was just nice.They're reasonably near where I stay, although not the nearest coffee shop (that'd be Loysel's Toy). But I'll definitely be back, as I'm regularly in the area.Parking can be quite limited especially during lunch and dinner hours, be prepared to scout/camp for lots.

photos.caption: Photo of Penny University - Singapore, Singapore
